title: Synthetic Recap
body:
LOS ANGELES — On a night where defense was the prevailing narrative, one man authored an offensive masterpiece for the ages. Tim Hardaway, with a performance that defied belief, single-handedly dismantled the Los Angeles Clippers, carrying the Miami Heat to a decisive 98-82 victory.

The final score suggests a team effort, but this was a one-man showcase. Hardaway wasn't just the best player on the floor; he was a force of nature, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 38 points. He operated with ruthless efficiency, connecting on 13 of his 22 field goal attempts and drilling an astonishing 8 three-pointers. Every time the Clippers threatened to close the gap, Hardaway had an answer, often from well beyond the arc, silencing the home crowd with another dagger.

While Alonzo Mourning anchored the paint with a formidable 17-point, 11-rebound double-double and PJ Brown cleaned the glass with 16 rebounds, their efforts were powerful supporting acts in the Hardaway symphony. The Clippers, led by Loy Vaught's 19 points and 14 rebounds, simply had no counter for the Heat point guard's historic outburst.

The story of this game, however, belongs solely to Tim Hardaway. In an era not yet defined by three-point barrages, his 8-for-12 shooting from deep was a prophetic display of modern basketball. He didn't just score; he dominated, controlling every facet of the game and delivering a performance that would be etched into the Miami Heat record books forever. It was a night where one superstar reached a legendary peak and, in doing so, powered his team to victory.
